tasks: Review the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com) and identify 3 key principles that can be applied to your current work. Write a brief summary of each principle and how you can incorporate them into your design process. (Reference: https://www.nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/) Score improvement: +5 points

Create a list of 10 common user research methods used in UX design, including both qualitative and quantitative approaches. Prioritize the top 3 most effective methods for your current role as a Strategic Lead. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/) Score improvement: +5 points

Apply Miller's Law to a recent design project, identifying areas where the law can be applied to improve user experience. Write a short reflection on how this law impacted your design decisions. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/millers-law/) Score improvement: +5 points

Conduct 2 mini-user interviews with colleagues or peers, using Occam's Razor as a framework for understanding their pain points and needs. Document the key findings in a concise report. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/occams-razor/) Score improvement: +5 points

Design an Aesthetic-Usability Effect experiment to test the impact of visual design elements on user behavior. Create a detailed plan, including participant recruitment and data analysis. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/aesthetic-usability-effect/) Score improvement: +5 points

Create a 'UX Fundamentals' cheat sheet, summarizing key concepts and principles from Laws of UX and Miller's Law. Share it with your team or colleagues as a resource for future reference. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/) Score improvement: +10 points

Develop a comprehensive 'UX Fundamentals' course outline, covering the key concepts and principles from Laws of UX, Miller's Law, Occam's Razor, and Aesthetic-Usability Effect. Create a detailed lesson plan for each topic. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/) Score improvement: +15 points

Create a 'Strategic Lead' portfolio piece that showcases your ability to apply UX Fundamentals in a strategic context. Write a brief reflection on how you incorporated these principles into the design process. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/) Score improvement: +20 points

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX Designer, you have the unique opportunity to drive user-centered design decisions that shape the future of products and experiences. With your exceptional skills in UI Craft & Visual Design and Collaboration & Communication, you can leverage your expertise to craft intuitive and engaging designs that delight users and drive business success.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Occam's Razor for Strategic Decision-Making
topics.summary: Developing the ability to distill complex UX problems into simple, actionable solutions will enhance your strategic lead role.
practice_points: Analyze 3 real-world design decisions and apply Occam's Razor to identify potential biases or oversimplifications. Document findings in a written report.

topics.name: Conducting User Research with the Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: Mastering user research techniques will help you uncover deeper insights and inform strategic design decisions. As a Strategic Lead, this skill is crucial for driving business outcomes.
practice_points: Conduct 5 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and document findings in a written report. Identify key pain points and opportunities for strategic design improvements.

topics.name: Creating Aesthetic-Usability Effect through Design Principles
topics.summary: Developing an understanding of the aesthetic-usability effect will enable you to create designs that are both visually appealing and user-friendly. As a Strategic Lead, this skill is essential for driving design excellence.
practice_points: Design 3 wireframes for a hypothetical product using principles from the Aesthetic-Usability Effect. Create a visual design system document outlining color, typography, and spacing tokens.
